document.masterDocTitle: Studies of Madagascan Ptiliidae (Coleoptera) 3: The genus Acrotrichis including twenty seven new species

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Studies of Madagascan Ptiliidae (Coleoptera) 3: The genus Acrotrichis including twenty seven new species

subSubSection.paragraph:
Habitus
Fig. 34 A
. Length 0.97 mm . Colour blackish brown, antennae and legs pale brown. Antennomeres 3–11 0.36 mm long
Fig. 34
C. Mentum and submentum chaetotaxy
Fig. 34
E. Width across eyes 0.37 mm . Pronotum 0.65 mm wide, 0.36 mm long, sides strongly rounded such that the angle with the posterior margin is almost obscured
Fig. 34
B. Elytra 0.52 mm long, 0.62 mm wide
Fig. 34
G. Posterior margin of mesoventral collar sloped at shoulders and with only a trace of a medial excision
Fig.
34
F. Metaventrum short, the posterior margin between the metacoxae broad
Fig.
34
F.
Etymology . Named after the squarish appearance of this species..

Remarks . The spermatheca is only likely to be confused with
clareae
but the short and broad elytra make this species immediately distinguishable on external characters. The lack of males may indicate that the species is parthenogenetic..
